description: A overheat trap indicates that the on board
tempature sensor has reported a overheat
condition. System will shutdown until unit has
sufficiently cooled such that operation may begin
again. A cold start trap will be issued when
the unit has come back on line.

event.Summary: Temperature $v3 reached overheat condition

description: Signifies that the value of one of the object identifiers
(or the value of an object below that in the MIB tree)
defined in the extremeSmartTrapRulesTable has changed,
and hence a new entry has been created in the
extremeSmartTrapInstanceTable. Such a trap is sent
at most once every thirty seconds if one or more entry
was created in the last thirty seconds.

event.Summary: New entry in extremeSmartTrapInstanceTable

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeSmartTrap RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime t 31536000 RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE

software. It is mandatory that this only contain
printable ASCII characters.

description: Signifies that the value of the extremeSlotModuleState for
the specified extremeSlotNumber has changed.
Traps will be reported only for significant states.

event.Summary: Module state is $v5

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeModuleStateChanged RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime t 31536000 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSlotNumber i 9999 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSlotModuleConfiguredType i 1 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSlotModuleInsertedType i 1 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSlotModuleState i 5

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: A unique integer identifying the particular slot
in the chassis.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSlotNumber

description: The configured module type for the given slot.
At startup, the module-type is none(1). It is
possible to configure the module-type even if there
is no module in the slot. If the current module in the
slot is different than the requested configured module-type,
then the current configuration for the module is erased and
the card will be restarted. The new configured module-type
will be recorded. Since the configured module type is different
than the actual module type, a moduleMismatch trap will be sent
and the extremeSlotModuleState for that module will show a
mismatch(3). Setting this variable to none(1) will clear the
previously assigned module-type of this slot, and all
configuration information related to the slot will be erased.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSlotModuleConfiguredType

description: The module type inserted into the slot. It is possible
to have a slot inserted into the slot even though
extremeSlotConfiguredType is none(1).
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSlotModuleInsertedType

description: The state of the module inserted in this slot.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSlotModuleState

description: This node discovers a new neighbor through Extreme Discovery
Protocol.

event.Summary: Discovered a new neighbor $v3 through Extreme Discovery Protocol

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: The ifIndex of the physical port on which this
entry was discovered via edp.
variables.name: EXTREME-EDP-MIB::extremeEdpPortIfIndex

description: The identifier associated with the neighbor.
variables.name: EXTREME-EDP-MIB::extremeEdpNeighborId

description: The time in seconds since this entry was last
updated.
variables.name: EXTREME-EDP-MIB::extremeEdpEntryAge

description: This object is an 'alias' name for the interface as
specified by a network manager, and provides a non-volatile
'handle' for the interface.
On the first instantiation of an interface, the value of
ifAlias associated with that interface is the zero-length
string. As and when a value is written into an instance of
ifAlias through a network management set operation, then the
agent must retain the supplied value in the ifAlias instance
associated with the same interface for as long as that
interface remains instantiated, including across all re-
initializations/reboots of the network management system
including those which result in a change of the interface's
ifIndex value.
An example of the value which a network manager might store
in this object for a WAN interface is the (Telco's) circuit
number/identifier of the interface.
Some agents may support write-access only for interfaces
having particular values of ifType. An agent which supports
write access to this object is required to keep the value in
non-volatile storage, but it may limit the length of new
values depending on how much storage is already occupied by
the current values for other interfaces.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of
the manufacturer, the product name and the version
of the hardware interface.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifDescr

description: No EDP updates are received from this neighbor within
the configured timeout period and this neighbor entry is aged
out by the device.

event.Summary: Neighbor $v3 is aged out by the device

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: The ifIndex of the physical port on which this
entry was discovered via edp.
variables.name: EXTREME-EDP-MIB::extremeEdpPortIfIndex

description: The identifier associated with the neighbor.
variables.name: EXTREME-EDP-MIB::extremeEdpNeighborId

description: The time in seconds since this entry was last
updated.
variables.name: EXTREME-EDP-MIB::extremeEdpEntryAge

description: This object is an 'alias' name for the interface as
specified by a network manager, and provides a non-volatile
'handle' for the interface.
On the first instantiation of an interface, the value of
ifAlias associated with that interface is the zero-length
string. As and when a value is written into an instance of
ifAlias through a network management set operation, then the
agent must retain the supplied value in the ifAlias instance
associated with the same interface for as long as that
interface remains instantiated, including across all re-
initializations/reboots of the network management system
including those which result in a change of the interface's
ifIndex value.
An example of the value which a network manager might store
in this object for a WAN interface is the (Telco's) circuit
number/identifier of the interface.
Some agents may support write-access only for interfaces
having particular values of ifType. An agent which supports
write access to this object is required to keep the value in
non-volatile storage, but it may limit the length of new
values depending on how much storage is already occupied by
the current values for other interfaces.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: A textual string containing information about the

of the hardware interface.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifDescr

description: A textual description of the entity. This value
should include the full name and version
identification of the system's hardware type
software operating-system, and networking
software. It is mandatory that this only contain
printable ASCII characters.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr

description: A unique integer identifying the particular slot
in the chassis.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSlotNumber

description: An Octet String indicating the status of the various processors
on an Intelligent Module. Each byte in the Octet String represents
state for one processor.
For the Avalanche based PoS and ARM modules, the first byte (from MSB)
represents the state of the General Purpose Processor, the second byte
the state of Network Processor 1, and the third byte the state of Network
Processor 2 and so on. A value of 0 in each byte indicates that the
Processor is not operational, while a value 1 indicates that it is.
variables.name: EXTREME-NP-MIB::extremeNPModuleProcessorState

description: MSM failover occurred.

event.Summary: MSM failover occurred due to $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeMsmFailoverTrap RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeMasterMSMSlot i 9999 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeMsmFailoverCause i 1

description: A textual description of the entity. This value
should include the full name and version
identification of the system's hardware type
software operating-system, and networking
software. It is mandatory that this only contain
printable ASCII characters.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr

description: The extremeSlotNumber of the master MSM module.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeMasterMSMSlot

description: The cause of the last MSM failover. never(1) means an
MSM Failover has not occurred since the last reboot.
admin(2) means the failover was initiated by the user.
exception(3) means the former master MSM encountered a
software exception condition. removal(4) means the master
MSM was physically removed from the chassis. hwFailure(5)
means a diagnostic failure was detected in the master MSM.
watchdog(6) means that the master MSM hardware watchdog
timer expired. keepalive(7) means the master MSM failed to
respond to slave keepalive requests. The MSM failover will
have been hitless only in the admin(2) and exception(3)
cases
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeMsmFailoverCause

description: The master node performed a hitless MSM failover, but the
master failed to resume normal operation within the reelect timeout.
Thus, a new master (this switch) was elected.

event.Summary: Master node failed to resume normal operation

authentication and logs in successfully into the network.

event.Summary: User $v6 has successfully logged into the network

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginUserLogin EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginStationMac s EXAMPL EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginStationAddr a 192.0.2.1 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginPortIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginAuthType i 0 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginSystemTime t 31536000 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginUser s EXAMPLE EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginSrcVlan s EXAMPLE EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginDestVlan s EXAMPLE EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginSessionStatus i 1 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginAuthDataBase s EXAMPLE EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginMoveFromVlanList s EXAMPLE EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginMoveToVlanList s EXAMPLE

description: MAC address of netlogin supplicant
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginStationMac

description: MAC address of netlogin supplicant
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginStationAddr

description: IfIndex of authenticator port to which the netlogin supplicant is
connected
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginPortIfIndex

description: IF supplicant is authenticated using remote authentication server
as RADIUS or locally using authenticator local user database
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginAuthType

description: The time when a netlogin event occurs and is
meaningful for accounting purposes.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginSystemTime

description: Information containing type of session as NETLOGIN or DOT1X
concatenated with userName i,e '[NETLOGIN | DOT1X]:<username>'
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginUser

description: Upon successful login this vlan will represent the one in which
user resides before authentication while upon logout this vlan will
be the one in which user resides before logout. If the user was authenticated
on multiple vlans (using the Extreme-Netlogin-Extended vlan vendor specific
attribute VSA 211) then this object represents the untagged vlan (if present) or the
tagged vlan with the lowest tag from the extremeNetloginMoveFromVlanList.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginSrcVlan

description: The description (name) of the VLAN in which user moves after
successful login or logout. If the user was authenticated on multiple vlans
(using the Extreme-Netlogin-Extended vlan vendor specific attribute VSA 211) then this
object represents the untagged vlan (if present) or the tagged vlan with the
lowest tag from the extremeNetloginMoveToVlanList.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginDestVlan

description: -success (1)
Successful login
-sessionReset (2)
Administrator has initialized Authentication State.
-fDBAgingInitiatedLogout (3)
Logout initiated due to FDB aging of client MAC
-userInitiatedLogout(4)
Graceful logout attempt from user
-sessionRefreshInitiatedLogout (5)
(Valid for web-based mode only) Logout initiated by
session-refresh mechanism.
-authenticationFailure(6)
Authentication Failure
-remoteAuthenticationServerFailure (7)
Remote Authentication server Failure.
-reauthenticationFailure (10)
Dot1X reauthentication failure.
-successWithRestrictedAccess (11)
802.1X supplicant will be authenticated but with restricted network access
-successWithTimeLimitedAccess (12)
802.1X supplicant will be given full network access for a limited time period
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginSessionStatus

description: The last authentication database used by the netlogin client to get authenticated.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginAuthDataBase

description: Upon successful login extremeNetloginMoveFromVlanList will represent the vlans in
which user resides before authentication and upon logout it represents the vlans
in which the user resides before unauthentication.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginMoveFromVlanList

description: Upon successful login extremeNetloginMoveToVlanList will represent the vlans in
which user resides after authentication and upon logout it represents the vlans
in which the user resides after unauthentication.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNetloginMoveToVlanList

description: This trap will be generated when a netlogin supplicant logs out.
This trap is meant to notify logout event only for already
authenticated and logged in supplicant.

event.Summary: User $v6 has successfully logged out

description: This trap will be generated on a valn for which gratuitous ARP protection has been
configured, when a gratuitous ARP does not match the internal static or secured IP<->MAC binding.

event.Summary: Gratuitous ARP $v4 doesn not match internal static or secured IP<->MAC binding

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeGratuitousArpViolation EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeArpSecurityVlanIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeArpSecurityVlanDescr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeArpSecurityPortIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeArpSecurityIpAddr a 192.0.2.1 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeArpSecurityMacAddress s EXAMPL

variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeArpSecurityPortIfIndex

description: source IP address of the ARP packet
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeArpSecurityIpAddr

description: source MAC address in the ARP packet
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeArpSecurityMacAddress

description: This trap is sent by Extreme's Network Management Applications when a change
in its inventory database occurs. This trap is not send by a router or switch.

event.Summary: Inventory database changed

description: The IP address of the device modified by Extreme's Network Management Application.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNMSDeviceAddress

description: This trap is sent by Extreme's Network Management Applications when a change
in its Topology database occurs. This trap is not send by a router or switch.

event.Summary: Topology database changed

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeNMSTopologyChanged

description: The extremeElrpVlanLoopDetected notification is generated
when the ELRP client detects a loop in the vlan.

description: The extremeEapsStateChange notification is generated
when the EAPS domain has a state change.

event.Summary: $v1 EAPS domain changed its state from $v3 to $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeEapsStateChange EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsMode i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsPrevState i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsState i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsFailedFlag i 1 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsPrimaryStatus i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSecondaryStatus i 0

description: The EAPS domain name.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsName

description: This indicates the mode of the EAPS domain.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsMode

description: This indicates the previous EAPS state of this EAPS
domain. Used in state change traps information.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsPrevState

description: This indicates the current EAPS state of this EAPS
domain.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsState

description: This indicates the status of the failed flag.
If the failed timer expires while its expiry action is
configured to sendAlert, this failed flag is set.
It is then cleared when the failed timer stops expiring, or
the expiry action is configured to openSecondaryPort.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsFailedFlag

description: This indicates the status of the EAPS domain's primary
ring-port.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsPrimaryStatus

description: This indicates the status of the EAPS domain's secondary
ring-port.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSecondaryStatus

description: The extremeEapsFailTimerExpFlagSet notification is
generated when the EAPS domain's fail timer expires
for the first time, while its state is not in Fail state.

event.Summary: Fail timer expired flag is set for $v1 EAPS domain

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeEapsFailTimerExpFlagSet EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsMode i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsPrevState i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsState i 0

domain. Used in state change traps information.

description: This indicates the current EAPS state of this EAPS
domain.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsState

description: The extremeEapsFailTimerExpFlagClear notification is
generated when the EAPS domain's Fail timer expired flag
is cleared.

event.Summary: Fail timer expired flag is cleared for $v1 EAPS domain

description: The extremeEapsPortStatusChange notification is
generated when an EAPS primary or secondary port changes state.

event.Summary: EAPS primary or secondary port changes state from $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeEapsPortStatusChange EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsPrimaryStatus i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSecondaryStatus i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastStatusChange u 9999

description: The EAPS domain name.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsName

description: This indicates the status of the EAPS domain's primary
ring-port.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsPrimaryStatus

description: This indicates the status of the EAPS domain's secondary
ring-port.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSecondaryStatus

description: Indicates the last time there was any change in
EAPS domain, EAPS port, shared port, or segment status on
the switch. Time changes for extremeEapsState,
extremeEapsSharedPortState, extremeEapsSharedPortSegmentStatus
extremeEapsFailedFlag, extremeEapsPrimaryStatus,
extremeEapsSecondaryStatus, extremeEapsSharedPortNbrStatus
extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerStatus,
extremeEapsSharedPortSegmentFlagFailed.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastStatusChange

description: The extremeEapsConfigChange notification is generated
when the EAPS configuration has changed. It is sent 30 seconds
after the first change is made to limit the number of traps sent

event.Summary: Changed EAPS configuration: $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeEapsConfigChange EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastConfigurationChange u 9999

description: Indicates the last time there was any change in
EAPS configuration on the switch.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastConfigurationChange

description: The extremeEapsLastStatusChangeTime notification is generated
10 seconds after a status change occurs. Within the 10 second period all
status changes cause extremeEapsLastStatusChange variable to be updated.
10 seconds after the first change, this trap is sent. This is to ensure
a management station is notified that a change occured, in case the regular
traps are dropped due to be being sent while the network is converging.

event.Summary: EAPS last status changed time: $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeEapsLastStatusChangeTime EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastStatusChange u 9999 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsStatusTrapCount c 9999

description: Indicates the last time there was any change in
EAPS domain, EAPS port, shared port, or segment status on
the switch. Time changes for extremeEapsState,
extremeEapsSharedPortState, extremeEapsSharedPortSegmentStatus
extremeEapsFailedFlag, extremeEapsPrimaryStatus,
extremeEapsSecondaryStatus, extremeEapsSharedPortNbrStatus
extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerStatus,
extremeEapsSharedPortSegmentFlagFailed.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastStatusChange

description: Indicates the number of status traps sent out since the switch
booted. Status traps counted include
extremeEapsSharedPortStateChange
extremeEapsRootBlockerStatusChange
extremeEapsPortStatusChange
extremeEapsStateChange
extremeEapsFailTimerExpFlagSet
extremeEapsFailTimerExpFlagClear.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsStatusTrapCount

description: The extremeBgpPrefixReachedThreshold notification is generated
when the number of prefixes received over this
peer session reaches the threshold limit.

event.Summary: Prefixes over the peer session reached the threshold limit

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeBgpM2PrefixReachedThreshold BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerRemoteAddr s EXAMPLE BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType i 0 BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerLocalAddr s EXAMPLE BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerLocalAddrType i 0

description: The address of the remote end of the peering session.
variables.name: BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerRemoteAddr

description: The address family of the remote end of the peering
session.
variables.name: BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType

description: The address of the local end of the peering session.
variables.name: BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerLocalAddr

description: The address family of the local end of the peering
session.
variables.name: BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerLocalAddrType

description: The extremeBgpPrefixMaxExceeded notification is generated
when the number of prefixes received over this
peer session reaches the maximum configured limit.

event.Summary: Prefixes over the peer session reached the maximum configured limit

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeBgpM2PrefixMaxExceeded BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerRemoteAddr s EXAMPLE BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType i 0 BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerLocalAddr s EXAMPLE BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerLocalAddrType i 0

description: The address of the remote end of the peering session.
variables.name: BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerRemoteAddr

description: The address family of the remote end of the peering
session.
variables.name: BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType

description: The address of the local end of the peering session.
variables.name: BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerLocalAddr

description: The address family of the local end of the peering
session.
variables.name: BGP4-V2-MIB::bgpM2PeerLocalAddrType

description: The extremeEapsFailTimerExpFlagSet notification is
generated when the EAPS domain's segment timer expires
for the first time.

event.Summary: EAPS domain segment timer expired flag is set

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeEapsSegmentTimerExpFlagSet EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeSegmentPort i 9999 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeSharedPort i 9999

description: The EAPS Shared Link's Segment Id.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeSegmentPort

description: The EAPS Shared Link's Shared port.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeSharedPort

description: The extremeEapsSegmentTimerExpFlagClear notification is
generated when the EAPS domain's Segment Fail timer
expired flag is cleared.

event.Summary: EAPS domain segment timer expired flag is cleared

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeEapsSegmentTimerExpFlagClear EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeSegmentPort i 9999 EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeSharedPort i 9999

description: The EAPS Shared Link's Segment Id.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeSegmentPort

description: The EAPS Shared Link's Shared port.
variables.name: EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeSharedPort

description: The extremeEapsSharedPortStateChange notification is generated
when the EAPS shared port state changes.

event.Summary: EAPS shared port state changed: $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortStateChange EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortLinkId i 9999 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortState i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortNbrStatus i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerStatus i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastStatusChange u 9999

description: The ifIndex of a port configured as an EAPS shared port.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortIfIndex

description: The configured Link Id for the EAPS shared port.
Each common link in the entire network will be assigned a
unique link Id. Each shared-port instance on either end
of this common link will be configured with this
link Id.
Value of 0 indicates the link Id is still not configured.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortLinkId

description: This indicates the state of the EAPS Shared port instance.
The states can be idle(0), ready(1), blocking(2), and
preforwarding(3).
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortState

description: This indicates the status of reachabilty to the neighbor
on the other end of the Shared-segment.
If the neighbor on the other end is reachable with
matching link-id and different modes, then the status is
NeighborUp.
If the neighbor is not reachable, this status is
NeighborDown.
If the neighbor is reachable, but with the same mode
then this status is set to Error.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortNbrStatus

description: If this shared port instance is not in Root blocker state
the status is False.
If the shared port is in Root blocker state, and its
path detect message is being returned to it, it is in
Active state.
If the shared port is in Root blocker state, but its
path detect message is not making it back to itself, then
its root blocker status is Inactive.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerStatus

description: Indicates the last time there was any change in
EAPS domain, EAPS port, shared port, or segment status on
the switch. Time changes for extremeEapsState,
extremeEapsSharedPortState, extremeEapsSharedPortSegmentStatus
extremeEapsFailedFlag, extremeEapsPrimaryStatus,
extremeEapsSecondaryStatus, extremeEapsSharedPortNbrStatus
extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerStatus,
extremeEapsSharedPortSegmentFlagFailed.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastStatusChange

description: The extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerChange notification is generated
when each switch detects a new rootblocker ID on the networks.

event.Summary: Detected a new rootblocker ID with status: $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeEapsRootBlockerStatusChange EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerStatus i 0 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerId i 9999 EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastStatusChange u 9999

description: The ifIndex of a port configured as an EAPS shared port.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortIfIndex

description: If this shared port instance is not in Root blocker state
the status is False.
If the shared port is in Root blocker state, and its
path detect message is being returned to it, it is in
Active state.
If the shared port is in Root blocker state, but its
path detect message is not making it back to itself, then
its root blocker status is Inactive.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerStatus

description: This is the Link Id of the Root Blocker in the entire
network.
If there is no root blocker in the network, this value
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerId

description: Indicates the last time there was any change in
EAPS domain, EAPS port, shared port, or segment status on
the switch. Time changes for extremeEapsState,
extremeEapsSharedPortState, extremeEapsSharedPortSegmentStatus
extremeEapsFailedFlag, extremeEapsPrimaryStatus,
extremeEapsSecondaryStatus, extremeEapsSharedPortNbrStatus
extremeEapsSharedPortRootBlockerStatus,
extremeEapsSharedPortSegmentFlagFailed.
variables.name: EXTREME-EAPS-MIB::extremeEapsLastStatusChange

description: This Notification indicates a change in the PoE PSU for the slot.

event.Summary: PoE PSU status changed

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremePethPSUStatusNotification EXTREME-POE-MIB::extremePethSlotPSUActive i 1 EXTREME-POE-MIB::extremePethSlotMainPseIndex i 9999

description: Inline Power supply status indication for the slot. Indicates which PSU
is currently active. In the case of a failover a none indication can
occur until one of the PSU has finished powering up.
variables.name: EXTREME-POE-MIB::extremePethSlotPSUActive

description: The index into the PethMainPseTable. Provides the
mapping of the slot identifier to pethMainPseGroupIndex.
variables.name: EXTREME-POE-MIB::extremePethSlotMainPseIndex

description: This Notification indicates when a LACP member-port has been added to the Aggregator.

event.Summary: LACP member-port $v2 has been added to the Aggregator $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeLacpAddPortToAggregator EXTREME-LACP-MIB::extremeLacpGroup s EXAMPLE EXTREME-LACP-MIB::extremeLacpMemberPort u 0

description: This represents the LACP LAG (Link Aggregation Group's)
identifier.
variables.name: EXTREME-LACP-MIB::extremeLacpGroup

description: This represents a member port within the LAG.
variables.name: EXTREME-LACP-MIB::extremeLacpMemberPort

description: This Notification indicates when a LACP member-port has been deleted from the Aggregator.

event.Summary: LACP member-port $v2 has been deleted from the Aggregator $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-V2TRAP-MIB::extremeLacpDeletePortFromAggregator EXTREME-LACP-MIB::extremeLacpGroup s EXAMPLE EXTREME-LACP-MIB::extremeLacpMemberPort u 0

description: This represents the LACP LAG (Link Aggregation Group's)
identifier.
variables.name: EXTREME-LACP-MIB::extremeLacpGroup

description: This represents a member port within the LAG.
variables.name: EXTREME-LACP-MIB::extremeLacpMemberPort
